website_summaries.verdict: You can see this phone's extra-large, orange backlit display from across the room. Phone sometimes fails to ring for incoming call.
pros: Extra-large tilt display is easy to see from a distance
10-number speed dial and 25 name and number phone book
cons: Ringer doesn't always work for incoming calls

website_summaries.verdict: Although designed primarily for home use, this phone would also work as a replacement office phone for visual or hearing-impaired office employees. We appreciate the oversize LCD display and rugged construction of this unit.
pros: Extra large buttons and audio enhancement make this corded phone ideal for older users
10 number speed dial and large backlit LCD display with complete Caller ID information
cons: Even with audio boost, the sound quality is variable
Single line only, more suited to home or small office use
No battery back-up, which can lead to data or memory loss

customer_reviews.title: FAILED ALMOST IMMEDIATELY
customer_reviews.text: NOT RECOMMENDED. This is the hard wired version of ATT's battery powered display/speakerphone. It worked well upon installation but failed almost immediately. Could no longer get a dial tone and the display went completely blank. The "menu" button used to do the setup also stopped working. This happened just outside the Amazon return window and I got no response from the seller when I attempted to contact them.
customer_reviews.author: Kim V.

customer_reviews.title: Great for senior use
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for my technology challenged mom to use in assisted living. She has done well- even accessing the answering machine. I mistakenly programmed long distance speed dial numbers without a one at the beginning- forgot that these are still required on landline phones! Once you start programming, it becomes very easy. I wish the directory would list alphabetically, but once you find the number, you just lift the cradle and it dials the number. Although the display window is adjustable, I am not happy with the contrast- not as pictured and not that easy to see. This is the best she has done with a complex phone- cell phones were just a bust.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon woman

customer_reviews.title: Answering machine is very buggy
customer_reviews.text: Sometimes it works and sometimes not, very frustrated with this phone. I just realized when someone calls me the answering machine is not picking up. It's also not playing the message I recorded but the automated msg but it is not saying "leave a message after the beep". So I had tried to call home and found this out. I test it when I get home and I hear my message on the phone ends and the automated response thru my phone. Terrible... This is the 2nd phone I've received. I returned the first one as defective also.
customer_reviews.author: Cheryl

customer_reviews.title: Defective Phone
customer_reviews.text: After less than a year, this phone malfunctioned. It will, all by itself, connect to a dial tone. If I am at home, I cannot hang up. I have to remove the wire at the phone jack before the phone will work again. If no one is at home, the dial tone makes the phone inoperable. This phone, in a vacation home, is used by our freeze alarm system to alert our plumber. Recently, our furnace failed and the house began to freeze up. The freeze alarm detected the event but with no phone working, the plumber was not notified. The pipes froze. We were lucky that it was not the fire alarm that couldn't get through.
customer_reviews.author: Piano Student

customer_reviews.title: Problems start in less than 6 months
customer_reviews.text: We loved this phone at first. After 5 months, however, we started having problems. Serious problems. Like, I can hear the caller on the other end of the phone, but they cannot hear me at all - dead silence for them. And - oddly enough - sometimes it reverses where they can hear me saying "hello? hello?" and I cannot hear them. Not cool. And no return option through Amazon after 30 days so now I've got to figure out how and whether it's worth getting AT&T to replace or repair this piece of junk. Phones used to last forever, now we cannot seem to find a landline phone worth a darn. It's so very frustrating.
customer_reviews.author: PMunroe

customer_reviews.title: Absolutely the BEST I could find!!!
customer_reviews.text: I had tried several land line phones after my ten year old beauty finally wore out, but none performed anywhere near as well as my old, larger one which, of course, is not made anymore. I did not need the added lines anymore, so this was perfect and "Viola", the Speaker Phone sounded every bit as good as my old phone, every time, reliably... which was something that the multiple replacements I tried could not do. Therefore, I do not hesitate in giving my endorsement to this fine product to anyone seeking a quality landline phone with quality speaker phone and caller ID features among many other nice features.
customer_reviews.author: Lenexan

customer_reviews.title: A really superb telephone
customer_reviews.text: This is an extremely nice phone. It is easy to set up. I especially like the large numbers on the key paid. They are easy to read and make keying in a phone number a quick and simple task. The phone is quite attractive with a sort of muted white color rather than bright white coloring. The functions on the phone all work well and it is easy to see the bright lighting,when you have an incoming call or someone leaves a message. And the cost for all of this,was in my mind very reasonable. If you are in the market for a very good land line phone than this is the phone for you.
customer_reviews.author: Jack Wendelken

customer_reviews.title: This Worked Well Until it Didn't
customer_reviews.text: I really liked this phone. Absolutely NO complaints, Did everything I expected. Unfortunately, the tone dial function stopped working after 10 months. (Apparently a defective tone generator). The phone would still dial out using "pulse" setting, but the tone function is necessary for most of the calls for which this phone was intended. (Reporting power outages, etc). I was VERY disappointed that the phone failed to work after less than one year. It is VERY good for elderly folk needing a large, easy to see touchpad and controls and , unlike our more modern phones, it still worked when the power was out.
customer_reviews.author: JonDal

customer_reviews.title: Don't buy this phone! 😰😰😰
customer_reviews.text: False advertising😰😰 No battery backup! No where to insert batteries any where on this phone! Claims that you can use 4 AA batteries for backup in case you lose power! Not True! Only works if You have electricity! So what's the point of even having a land line in case power goes out in a storm??
customer_reviews.author: David Rodriguez

customer_reviews.title: UPDATE - 6 MONTHS 2nd One Purchased Receiver Shorting Out
customer_reviews.text: Like the title states its the 2nd one purchased. 1st one lasted me about 3 or 4 years so why not get another. Its the greatest lowest-priced phone of this type with the number of features for my needs. January 6, 2020 - Purchased/Ordered on June 28, 2019 Not even 6 months and in the middle of talking on it I could hear the person on the other end but they could not hear me. I had to switch to speaker phone mode to continue the conversation!
customer_reviews.author: Sweet Mischief

customer_reviews.title: excellent basic phone for the price
customer_reviews.text: Since I use cell for most calls, I stripped down my landline services to save money. I no longer get caller ID or mailbox, but this has an answering machine. I rarely answer the landline, just check it for messages. In general, only friends and family leave messages. Great way to avoid spam calls and save money. This is a good quality phone, does all I need it to.
customer_reviews.author: Duck363

customer_reviews.title: Sound quality terrible
customer_reviews.text: Sounds like Demosthenes practicing with pebbles in his mouth. The answering machine playback is garbage. Trying to record a clear announcement message for your answering machine likewise crummy. Like in REALLY, REALLY terrible. If I could buy it again, I wouldn't I don't care fore the orange LCD screen - shades of blue, gray, and black would be better. May go back to my old phone with a separate answering machine.
customer_reviews.author: Kemo Sabe

customer_reviews.title: I was hoping for more
customer_reviews.text: The bass & treble helps slightly and audio assist just raises the volume a notch. Its ok but I was hoping for more. Perhaps my hearing needs more help than I thought. The one big turn off is all the other settings. Its design I think is over complicated. If there is an online manual I would read it first before making a buying decision. Oh and whats with the missed calls? It adds another one to the list after every call. I'm not sure how high it counts but I am at 35 now and I receive very few calls. I don't see a way to clear so I'll just let it keep counting
customer_reviews.author: R. Elliott

customer_reviews.title: Wouldn't call out
customer_reviews.text: I installed this phone 8/17. The next day, I had problems with my router, my internet, my wireless printer, my fax and all sorts of other things. And couldn't call out. Didn't know which device was the problem. After having 3 AT&T techs to my home to find the problem, they checked everything which was ok. I finally thought about when I installed the phone. I disconnected it (in my office) and had husband to call out from the living room phone which worked perfectly. One month, and there was a problem with this phone. My previous (same model) phone has worked perfectly, but this updated model, not so much.
customer_reviews.author: Mary Lou Froese

customer_reviews.title: Quality of sound good is the only good thing about it
customer_reviews.text: Manual very difficult to follow re settings. Easy to turn down/off ringer, but to silence any incoming messages, I have to turn off the machine. This morning I had ringer off AND "machine will not answer msgs" AND a robocall msg surprised me despite the settings. Also, it's VERY dicey adjusting the volume of incoming speaker--seems I can only adjust it by turning answering function off and then VERY quickly hitting the up/down arrows as soon as I turn it on again. If I wait even a second, I have to turn off/on and try again. It would have been nice to have one control silence the speaker/ringer volume at one time.
customer_reviews.author: Alex

customer_reviews.title: great phone
customer_reviews.text: Nice phone for the price. the numbers are large enough the sound is great with volume control. Easy to program saved numbers. I replaced an older version with this same phone. was 10 years old but I broke it when I dropped the hand set. CON: can`t recall messages that have already played.If not fast enough to jot down info or numbers, it is all lost.. sigh Had hoped with the newer version that would be available 'replay" Still a great phone
customer_reviews.author: LEW

customer_reviews.title: Excellent phone for the price
customer_reviews.text: This phone replaced another AT&T unit we had for about 15 years that finally decided to no longer show incoming phone numbers. Something we all need in this time of spam phone calls. It took me about half an hour to set it up and I found the directions very understandable and easy to follow. The back lighting on the display is a nice feature that we did not have on our earlier phone. I keep the directions nearby so I can reference it when I want to do something that I don't do often; like delete the entire call log or want to re-record our message. The directory of saved numbers is easy to find and use.
customer_reviews.author: P. Fisher

customer_reviews.title: Works great
customer_reviews.text: This is a good phone from a programming standpoint and for someone who can't see well. I bought if for my father, so I don't really use it, but I have used it a couple of times to make calls and it sounds fine. There are a lot of things you can program and you can even change the number of rings by increments of 1. Other phones will only give you the option of 2, 4 or 6 rings, or something like that. The display is easy to read. The downside is, if someone is not very technically skilled, this phone will be difficult for them to program.
customer_reviews.author: Y. T.

customer_reviews.title: Stopped working after 4 months
customer_reviews.text: Worked fine till it stopped workin 4 months after purchase. Amazon wouldn’t allow a return or exchange. They did connect me with AT&T the manufacturer, and AT&T is going to send a replacement, however I first have to send in the current phone and that was $13 shipping that I had to pay myself. Better than nothing, but AT&T really needs to get their act together and provide a phone that is dependable.
customer_reviews.author: Zen Girl

customer_reviews.title: Large clear buttons and easy to use.
customer_reviews.text: I really like this phone. Not overly complicated. Big numbers, volume is certainly loud and clear. I have it on the lowest so I have several levels to go. I like using the speaker feature for my calls and it works great. Have not had it long but so far very good. Also I bought the white phone, I think it makes everything a little more brighter, easier to see against my black desk ;) Programming was not difficult, everything clearly marked and the large display lights up when machine is in use. Everything I was looking for.
customer_reviews.author: donna robertson

customer_reviews.title: Sound quality is not good
customer_reviews.text: The good aspects of this phone are that it is inexpensive, easy to set up, and easy to use. The poorer aspects have to do with sound quality. The sound quality of the hand-held receiver is acceptable, and not really good. But the quality of sound reproduction for the speaker is only fair, not even really very acceptable. With the speaker, you can make out what people are saying, so at least it is usable. So as a caveat for this phone: you are getting what you pay for. I am a little surprised that AT&T would put its name on this product.
customer_reviews.author: James L Shead

customer_reviews.title: Easy-to-use feature phone for an analog phone jack
customer_reviews.text: Purchased this to install at a (non-technical) friend's house on the occasion of their dropping their analog landline and upgrading to a modem-based VoIP service. Compared to adding an external Caller ID display unit, purchasing this new phone was actually less expensive, and certainly simpler to setup and operate. Since installing it about a month ago, I've have heard absolutely no questions or complaints from my friend. That means this phone works reliably and is straightforward to use. What more could you ask?
customer_reviews.author: CFortC

customer_reviews.title: Good phone, good deal
customer_reviews.text: This was a gift for my elderly mother who likes it very much. Since it replaced another AT &T phone, there was nothing to program...essentially plug and play. She has AT & T voice mail so the record button must be in the "off" position for voicemail to pick up, otherwise the phone recorder picks up the call and answers with a male metallic voice. And, the incoming call doesn't show up on the tv when phone recorder is on. Other than that there is nothing "wrong" with the whole set up.
customer_reviews.author: shar

customer_reviews.title: Simply the Best!
customer_reviews.text: Wonderful design and practicality; clear voice messages; innumerable and practical features; super simple to understand and use features; priced very well.........a few years ago this model would cost nearly $100; well designed keyboard with excellent light buttons for some features; very large numerals for those with eyesight issues. In summary, a GREAT PHONE and GREAT PRICE!
customer_reviews.author: glenn b

customer_reviews.title: Great Corded Phone
customer_reviews.text: I love these phones - each has an answering system, speakerphone, redial, memory dial and other features. I've rid myself of all wireless/blu-tooth in my home and this is a great alternative without giving up some of the stuff we need. Very happy so far. Only had one mess up - the answering machine decided only short (30 sec) messages are worth recording so it cuts off at that point. I'm using that as an extension - without turning the answering machine part on. Works great!
customer_reviews.author: E. D.

customer_reviews.title: telephone, wall phone, table phone, answer phone, Caller ID, Speaker Phone, Large dial buttons
customer_reviews.text: Best standard phone on the market. Bought another one for an elderly family member. You can shut off ringer or the answer phone or both ringer and answer phone. Large key pad. Lighted display. To have full value, have Caller ID. It has a lot of options for usage, so keep manual handy until you are familiar or to refresh memory. The Caller Log feature is very helpful, when ringer & answer phone are both off, because the Caller Log keeps all attempts to reach you. Speaker button is valuable, especially when I'm put on "hold'. I just lay down the handset, leave the Speaker button ON. Then go about other things when suspecting a long wait time.
customer_reviews.author: Richard Whitlock

customer_reviews.title: NO BATTERY BACKUP
customer_reviews.text: My AT&T phone from 1th 1990's had a place to hold 4, 1.5 volt batteries. This ensures that the phone will work if the AC power goes out. This is just when you need to call the Electric Company to get the power fixed. But, you can't because the phone does not include battery backup. In addition, all the "programming" of memorized numbers, etc., is lost when the power goes off. Even a short AC power outage I'm just searched on Amazon for similar phones WITH battery backup. No luck...
customer_reviews.author: Fred Seigneur

customer_reviews.title: CALLER ID DOES NOT WORK
customer_reviews.text: Caller ID works after you pick up the receiver but not before. As the phone is ringing and you want to see who is calling the only message is LINE IN USE. After you answer it tells you who is calling. The wall mount is also terrible if you plan on hanging it. I sent back the first one because of the faulty caller ID and this one is no different. As soon as I get back from BestBuy with a new phone I will send this one back too. BTW, I contacted Amazon and they were to contact the manufacturer and get back to me but they never did.
customer_reviews.author: H2Obuffalo

customer_reviews.title: Failed out of the box
customer_reviews.text: The answering machine portion of the product did not work properly. I configured it and it would answer and record the message but it would never hang up / release the line. Tried resetting and trying again but it just plain did not work in replacing my old machine. Otherwise, the product seemed fine and I did not see others complaining of the same problem in the reviews. Thanks to Amazon for the pain-free return though!
customer_reviews.author: Forbin

customer_reviews.title: Great, awesome corded phone ever!
customer_reviews.text: I have been using this phone for a few weeks now, its excellent! I got this phone hook up to my Ooma internet station.. The speaker phone volume sound way louder than any normal cell phone, the buttons are bigger, very easy to dial, the sound quality is very clear. This is the BEST corded phone ever to get rid of my modern Panasonic cordless phone.
customer_reviews.author: thom

customer_reviews.title: Great product for the price
customer_reviews.text: There simply isn't anything to complain about. This phone is pretty sweet for a $20 landline desk phone. The angled caller id back lit display is big and bright which is exactly what I was looking for and the speaker function is loud and clear for hands free use. I won't use the answering machine features but those are easily disabled. Very pleased with this purchase. Update: Ok, I found something to complain about. I don't use the answering machine because I have voicemail. However, this phone does not display "new voicemail" as my other phones do. That's an irritation.
customer_reviews.author: Stewart N. Grant

customer_reviews.title: It Ain't No Western Electric Model 302
customer_reviews.text: It does everything I need as a main phone... at a modest price. Growing up with old style black bakelite phones that weighed many pounds, there isn't much out there these days that is going to please my sense of what is desirable in a phone. But over a period of a few years, I've at least learned not to hate this phone. It tells me who is calling, who has called, and keeps track of the phone numbers I call most often. I'm sure it also gives foot massages, can cook dinner, and wash the dishes.... if only I'd just bother to sit and read the manual. Not gonna' happen!
customer_reviews.author: Tikvah

customer_reviews.title: Works great after you jump all the hurdles it posseses...
customer_reviews.text: Although they say they technically support this phone, I have found that there is absolutely no way you can get to a technical person to get assistance. AT&T Is blowing smoke up your skirt when they say it is "Technically Supported". When trying to download their PDF Owner's Manual, you will be advised that AT&T has no listing for this telephone by this CL4940 Model Number. The phone works, but you definitely have to have a Master's Degree in Telephonics to make it work the way it's supposed to. Can be VERY aggravating until you figure it out!!
customer_reviews.author: G. Davis

customer_reviews.title: Looks Great but ...
customer_reviews.text: This is a good looking phone with all kinds of features. Problem is that I am with Spectrum and it did not work with my Spectrum internet. I am having to return it. If you are just buying it to use as a phone, it might work great but if you are wanting to use it with a bundle such as from Spectrum, you are out of luck. Since it is AT&T, it might work with an AT&T bundle. I have never experienced anything like this with a home landline phone.
customer_reviews.author: phyllis krantzman

customer_reviews.title: A great caller ID with a great phone too.
customer_reviews.text: What I liked, readable caller ID, speaker phone, speed dial, last number redial, volume control - clear sound, phone number directory. Other features: answering machine, equalizer, and more! I was shopping for a caller ID. The one I received quit after three days. All had weak reviews. I found this wall/desk phone with a large caller ID display for about the same price .I decided to replace my present wall phone. I'm delighted. Easy to program, though I did download the detailed manual from their website. Amazing features at an unbelievable price. By the way always keep one phone hard wired. Cordless phones work well, but quit if there's a power failure.
customer_reviews.author: PICKLES

customer_reviews.title: A Good Call
customer_reviews.text: This unit replaced an older AT&T wall phone whose display wasn't lighted and was hard to see. It was easy to install and set up, has lots of features, and has good sound. However, both it and the older unit have a quirk in that in setting the time, day, month and year, the year will periodically change for no reason, which causes the announced day for recorded messages to be wrong. That requires resetting the year frequently. Otherwise, its a good phone for a reasonable price.
customer_reviews.author: Clarice

customer_reviews.title: Time to replace this model when . . .
customer_reviews.text: I love this phone, however, am rating it a 3. After about a year of use, I could only make some outgoing calls, but most outgoing numbers were dropped. After placing new in-line EXCELSUS Z-BLOCKERS, it came down to trying a new phone of the same type. Once that was done, outgoing calls were no problem.
customer_reviews.author: Retired pediatric nurse

customer_reviews.title: Not bad overall.
customer_reviews.text: The buttons tend to want to stick a bit, and there is a second or so pause between number input, and the sound/display on the screen. I would reconmend getting a sound filter reguardless of the service that you use to help with noise and static. Overall everything seems to work fine, and it is easy to set up. Note that when adding contacts you can use the right skip button towards the top of the keypad to input a space sonyou can add first and last name.
customer_reviews.author: Codie Morehead

customer_reviews.title: Easy and accessible usage.....
customer_reviews.text: I bought this product to replace an older wireless telephone. I am not very technologically proficient and so I wanted a device that was both easy to use and easy to read. This product does all of this and more. I am VERY PLEASED with this telephone and it was easy to implement its usage by easy to follow instructions and intuitive technology. Purchased this wired phone in order to cut down on rather significant EMF exposure radiating from my old cordless phone.
customer_reviews.author: D. Duarte

customer_reviews.title: You know your getting old....
customer_reviews.text: If the use of a landline in this day and age doesn't make you feel old, the big buttons and large display will certainly do it. It's still a great phone, especially for WFH conference calls. The speaker is excellent, the microphone picks up nicely, and the mute is very handy when your not paying 100% attention to the one guy who drones on for 15 minutes without taking a breath.
customer_reviews.author: Robert Roth

customer_reviews.title: Phone was used
customer_reviews.text: The box, which was shipped inside another box with other items, looked like it was dragged down the street. It was also dirty, as in I pulled it out of the outer box and my hand was black. It is missing the power cord so I cannot even test it. I am very unhappy.
customer_reviews.author: Jim Edwards

customer_reviews.title: This is a fine phone, especially for the price
customer_reviews.text: This is a fine phone, especially for the price. There are a few shortcomings, for me, though. I set up the directory OK. But when I want to access the directory you have to page through all of the names/numbers to get the one you want. There was no way to enter them alphabetically. Same goes for the speed dial. The instructions were not clear as to how to dial from the directory or speed dial. I am kinda getting use to looking up the number first, then picking up the handset, which, then dials the number for you. Seems like a reverse of my previous ATT phone.
customer_reviews.author: Richard L

customer_reviews.title: Something to be said for having a landline telephone.
customer_reviews.text: In a high tech world where phones are smaller, touch sensitive and fit in your pocket There's something to be said for simplicity and using a landline phone. You pick up the receiver, you can have auto dial of contacts or get pleasure from pushing the large display buttons yourself. It has an answering machine and a directory for all your" Contacts". Easy to read digital display for Caller ID too. Works well for hearing aid users or hard of hearing. It makes talking on the phone a sedentary, focused activity. Best of all...no texting while driving because the cord won't reach that far!
customer_reviews.author: Hilry Reese Cockrum

customer_reviews.title: Does not come with instructions.
customer_reviews.text: Once you download the instruction manual and read everything you will be operating and using the phone like a pro. It has all of the features I need. I don't worry about robocalls because they never leave a message. My calls get screened and I know who is calling and I can see their number too. Nobody knows who I am because the guy who asks callers to leave a message is very professional .
customer_reviews.author: Donna

customer_reviews.title: Easy To See, Easy To Hear
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this for an elderly woman who swears by this phone. This item was on the expedited covid list and was delivered less than 24 hours from ordering, by an out of state Amazon truck. The numbers are huge in this phone, as well as the display. This phone has hearing assist and is quite loud. It is suitable for people who are hard of hearing, and those who have difficulty seeing small print.
customer_reviews.author: Dylan

customer_reviews.title: Phone may be what you are looking for in the beginning, but doesn't last.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this phone for my Mother in June of 2016. Now it is dead as a door nail and I didnt buy the protection policy. Wish I would have. It does not work at all. Will not ring and will not allow her to call out. A phone for seniors should be dependable. Not quit working after a year and a half. Will not buy again.
customer_reviews.author: Deb. B.

customer_reviews.title: My Daughter forced me to buy this
customer_reviews.text: We haven’t had an answering machine in years abd my daughter got rly fed up and found this on amazon knowing I don’t like modern things abd forced me to buy it. It’s white and gray so it’s not dark which I love. It has a rly nice sound and can be set to a good volume (2). The lcd screen is nice and NOT burning my eyes out. You can even add contacts on the phone. And it has all these buttons just so nice.... like NOT touch screen nice.
customer_reviews.author: Mary Labbe

customer_reviews.title: Great for us oldies but goodies for use with majicjack phone system
customer_reviews.text: I don't want to pay for a house phone, but find cell phone hard to hear at times, plus, really enjoy the "feel" of a phone in my hand. This phone meets all my needs. Easy to set up with a VOIP service, and gives me all the features I need, and more, for a phone. WELL WORTH the money. Only bad note, but not a deal breaker. I bought it "used" and old owners phone contacts were still stored in phone. REMINDER for returning phones of any sort.....DELETE YOUR INFO!!!!
customer_reviews.author: M. Joan Burke

customer_reviews.title: This is not a comment on the quality of the ...
customer_reviews.text: This is not a comment on the quality of the phone. I never plugged it in. This shipper sent me an old item. The original package seal was broken, and the phone had been sitting in the light (possibly sunlight) for a very long time. The plastic was completely yellowed, except where the handset covered it (like tan lines from a swimsuit). When I am purchasing a "new" item, I expect it to be truly new.
customer_reviews.author: Steven M. Sallee

customer_reviews.title: Helpful Phone for Elderly
customer_reviews.text: I bought this as a gift for an elderly couple who were unable to attend our Internet telephone conferences: and this fit the bill! The large numbers and simple display options make it easier to use. They are very grateful. Thank you AT&T for making this and Amazon for offering it at an affordable price. If you know anyone who is in need of a speaker phone, especially those with limited physical means, this is definitely the one to get
customer_reviews.author: andrew k.

customer_reviews.title: Great Sound, Call Back Features
customer_reviews.text: In addition to the normal functions, this has a few added. First is the increased clarity of the sound. Just outstanding. Second is the ability to Call Back any number listed in the Received Call listing just by lifting the receiver while that number is displayed - always a problem with the previous models. One minor "defect": you can't hear yourself over the receiver - all you hear is the other party. Screen OK, but there are better displays - angle of view too narrow.
customer_reviews.author: SemiPro

customer_reviews.title: Here is the ONE dislike and irritant
customer_reviews.text: Here is the ONE dislike and irritant ... After you spend all the time getting it set up and happen to unplug it for any reason or you lose power - Guess What.... Yap you get to start all over. You would think some common sense and logic was applied and there would have been some form of backup or write to IC memory. That sux so bad !!!!!!!!!!!!
customer_reviews.author: Mr. Hughes

customer_reviews.title: Good buy!
customer_reviews.text: I'm very happy with this phone and answering machine combo. I have ancient copper wire phone service (fiber optic is supposed to be installed soon) and have had trouble with other answering machines distorting calls and messages into everything from screeches to a deep, hollow echo., but this one works just fine. As someone who's not at all fond of phones, I'm also pleased with the ease of adjusting the ring to several different volume levels including "off", and the ease of turning off the answering function. A good value for the money, IMO.
customer_reviews.author: Mariah York

customer_reviews.title: Total 25 contact numbers can be stored.  It's probably as good as it gets for this price.
customer_reviews.text: Pros; Ease of use. Easy to figure out how to store and erase the contact numbers. Speaker phone works well. Ringer control is easy to figure out. Volume is controlled in 5 levels from LOUD to soft in clear tone. Cons: There are only 25 contacts to store including speed dial. It's probably as good as it gets for this price. I have 3 of this same phone; each is programmed with 25 phone numbers to make total of 75. If I set all three phones with Answering machine turned on, no call can be answered. That changed my practice to turn on Answering function only on one phone.
customer_reviews.author: A hiker

customer_reviews.title: Great value! Good phone!
customer_reviews.text: So far so good!! This was not as expensive as Wal-Mart!! I got white, which was cheaper for some reason than the black one, but I'm ok with white! I prefer saving bux. The phone works fine, has all the features I needed especially the speaker phone. Setting the outgoing message, time, date, etc was all pretty easy. I hope it lasts a long time!
customer_reviews.author: Signlady

customer_reviews.title: Well made and easy to use.
customer_reviews.text: Finding a good unit for use on a landline is difficult. We use our landline both as a phone and as part of our condo's intercom and security system. I like the easy to read call log. The buttons are large enough for my husband to see without feeling like we have a old folks phone. The speaker phone functions quite nicely. We use our landline about the same amount as we use our cell,
customer_reviews.author: Diane Santoriello

customer_reviews.title: This ATT model is defective
customer_reviews.text: This ATT model is defective. It is the second phone, same model, with this problem. The display was good,so I tried again. Problem: when I lower ring volume to No Ring for unwanted calls, eventually, the No Ring feature gets stuck,and the phone no longer rings for any call. The ATT manual does not address this problem ATT has not offered tech assistance. I recommend Amazon not carry this model. It is a waste of money. I request a credit from Amazon for another landline if possible.
customer_reviews.author: nicola miller

customer_reviews.title: Don't bother unless you live on speaker phone
customer_reviews.text: I would return this phone, but it appears the return period is over. We don't make a lot of landline calls, and with so many others calling in on cell phones in "iffy" areas, it took over a month to figure out that it is this phone that sometimes does not allow the other party to hear us, though we can hear them. The only work around is to put on the speaker phone when the other party starts complaining that they can't hear us. So, it's back to the drawing board for a reliable Caller ID enabled phone. What a waste of money.
customer_reviews.author: Arizona Cats

customer_reviews.title: I really like this one
customer_reviews.text: This replaced a wireless phone in kitchen, which I barely used anyway. I really like this one. Easy to mount, set up and use. Has everything I want: caller id, speaker phone, messages. The large display seemed, well, like I had entered the senior zone, however, I have come to really like the clear display and easy to use panel.
customer_reviews.author: carolinbridge

customer_reviews.title: Great for a Se
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for my 96 yr old dad’s bedroom. Easy for him to use. Has large numbers and was able to save are numbers on speed dial for him since he sometimes has trouble dialing. I wish it would of had plastic slides over the speed dial numbers we saved like are V-Tech cordless phone in the kitchen so we could put our pictures in them. This way he just pushes our pictures to dial. Instead I wrote our names on the speed dial numbers.
customer_reviews.author: Priscilla

customer_reviews.title: Great for the Price!
customer_reviews.text: Wanted a big button, speaker phone and this one came just like the picture. Speaker works great for hands free use and the digital readout makes life a lot easier. Only reason I didn't give it 5 stars is that the buttons don't press real smoothly and easily. When you press a number, the button doesn't go down evenly.....it kind of rocks or wobbles side to side. Other than that, I love the phone and its features. Great for the price!
customer_reviews.author: Kael

customer_reviews.title: Great for seniors!
customer_reviews.text: I love this phone! The larger buttons and lighted screen is a huge plus for seniors! The only thing I do not like is the handset is extremely light and falls off unless perfectly placed. I also like the button that you can leave on and you can hear even from another room so you can screen your calls! GREAT buy for the money-highly recommend!
customer_reviews.author: BH

customer_reviews.title: (The great majority are not
customer_reviews.text: With the increase in junk phone calls, we decided to get a second one of this type to make it easier to see if the callers were real people. (The great majority are not.) The new one sits on my husband's desk, and it's breaking him of the habit of picking up junk phone calls because he can see how many are not worth his movement.
customer_reviews.author: ann

customer_reviews.title: This is a great phone for seniors who have trouble dialing because you can pre-program a speed dial
customer_reviews.text: This is a very nice phone. My dad who's in an assisted living needed a land-line. We were able to program this at our home even though we don't have a land line. They programmed our number and each of our kids and a few other grandkids and now he's able to use the speed dial and push the number of the child. Sounds great he's very happy with it.
customer_reviews.author: homeron

customer_reviews.title: Overall it's a good phone
customer_reviews.text: I've used this phone (as a back up landline) for a while and so far it works very well. The sound quality is very good and it's easy to program. Called ID and the function buttons are easy to read. The handset is lightweight and the answering machine does a good job. Overall it's a good phone.
customer_reviews.author: JJ

customer_reviews.title: it's a friendly phone
customer_reviews.text: We like that we can easily see who is calling. This was the issue with the phone we replaced with this one. The sound quality is very good both on speaker and using the handset, additionally, the volume control is user friendly. As an added bonus, it would seem that the prerecorded message is a turn-off to telemarketers! So funny!!! It must confuse their computers..... one computer gets another? At any rate our telemarketing calls have begun to decrease.
customer_reviews.author: Fufie 63

customer_reviews.title: Excellent phone
customer_reviews.text: The eyes are not what they used to be, the large keys are clearly marked. I have worn out one of these now over a few years, this is the replacement, and they seem to hold up really well. The display is also great. On the old one it was the hookswitch that finally gave out after a couple years of good service. We have 6 of them in the house in various rooms, and the one that gave out was in the garage and got a lot of smoke and dust and was well used.
customer_reviews.author: David M. Lowrance

customer_reviews.title: My Favorite
customer_reviews.text: I have actually owned this phone in the past. I used it for years and then "up-graded" to one of those cordless units with several handsets. Not happy. It was so long since I had purchased the AT&T unit that the retail store had gone out of business. Amazon to the rescue! Again! I recommend this product.
customer_reviews.author: Topper Movius

customer_reviews.title: Works as advertized
customer_reviews.text: We were fed up with the voice mailbox provided by our lad line company so we tried out this phone specifically because it had voice messaging. It has totally lived up to expectations. Set up the voice message system with ease. The display is large and easy to read < a real geed thing for us older folk>. Personally, we can not say one negative thing about this phone.
customer_reviews.author: John Doe

customer_reviews.title: Good for older adult
customer_reviews.text: Got this for an older person to replace a standalone caller ID box as well as an answerer that were dying. We helped set it up and it has been working great. The older person's eyes appreciate the big buttons, big backlit display and loud ringer. I can confirm that the phone works if unplugged, which means that during a blackout you can make and take calls (although all other features like the caller ID and answering machine don't work without power).
customer_reviews.author: Gadget Man

customer_reviews.title: Display only lays flat and does not tilt and lock in place.
customer_reviews.text: The problem with the phone is that it came broken, specifically, the display only lays flat, when you try to tilt it up, it simply falls down and is not able to be held in place at an upright angle. Our other LC4940 was able to tilt and lock at certain angles (until the tilt function broke after a year's use), but this replacement unit simply lays flat at all times. We will probably end up putting a piece of wood to hold up the display, but we should have to do such a thing; it should have came working right out of the box.
customer_reviews.author: toolperson

customer_reviews.title: Good price for this landline phone.
customer_reviews.text: The setup was relatively easy. Disappointed that there was no spot for adding a battery backup in case power went down in the house. The handset cord was quickly replaced for a longer one as well, but over all, the phone quality is nice, and the speakerphone is easy to use. Happy with it and it's answering capabilities.
customer_reviews.author: Michelle Arthur

customer_reviews.title: Bad product upgrade
customer_reviews.text: Had the previous version of the phone. This version double enters calls to the call log so you have to delete twice and does not display the area code for local numbers. Also this version dropped the ability to re-dail the same number. Really a major step backwards from the previous version
customer_reviews.author: Dragonmageds

customer_reviews.title: No Back Up Batteries!
customer_reviews.text: No Back Up Battery! I needed a corded phone for when the electricity goes out and the cordless phones and cell phones don't work. The phones I've had in the past with those electronic digital readouts, multiple setting choices, and answering machine had back up batteries so you don't lose all your settings. It's a pain to try set the time and date, ringer choices, and record the greeting every time the electricity goes out (a lot here). Doesn't make sense.
customer_reviews.author: Lani Bear

customer_reviews.title: Did everything she needed
customer_reviews.text: Excellent. Did everything my 85 year old mother needed. She is very pleased with the large display so she knows who is calling, the speed dial and the answering machine. We did discover the button for turning the answering machine on and off so if your answering machine isn't working, check that first. We guess she accidently touched it and didn't know it.
customer_reviews.author: H S

customer_reviews.title: Great easy to use phone w/ answering machine & caller ID. Many features
customer_reviews.text: This is a really nice phone. Easy to read, nice big buttons, easy to read caller ID panel that gives you the choice to brighten or lower contrast. Very easy to use. I actually sent it back because I purchased a NEW one & was sent a refurbished one. I bought it for my father & did not want a second hand product. I always buy, NEW. SELLER IS AWESOME!
customer_reviews.author: CZ

customer_reviews.title: Switch hook broke 2 years in
customer_reviews.text: The switch hook started sticking, a mechanical issue which basically renders the phone line disconnected, and I couldn't get through to my elderly Mom. I contacted AT&T asking for troubleshoot or replacement and they were totally unhelpful. They sent their generic list of trouble shoots that had nothing to do with my specific issue, which is a mechanical flaw with the switch hook. I explained the issue two times and got nowhere.
customer_reviews.author: Michelle in New Paltz

customer_reviews.title: Keeps malfunctioning with stored telephone numbers
customer_reviews.text: This is my second AT&T phone. First one worked great, would dial back incoming number and stored numbers. Finally couldn't read the numbers so we decided to replace. This one will dial by itself one of my stored numbers, try to dial back from an incoming number and it won't work. The earpiece of the phone slips out of the cradle of the phone when no one is even close to it. Wish I could get another one like my first one.
customer_reviews.author: DJN

customer_reviews.title: Not Happy!!
customer_reviews.text: I am not happy with this phone. It will not display the telephone numbers of incoming calls, even though we have caller ID and another phone we have does just that. We are not using the answering system, and have it hooked up to an external answer machine. That answer machine will verbalize the number coming in (another indication that our caller ID through our carrier is working just fine), but I want to be able to see it on the new phone, because often names are associated with the number. There is also no Caller ID log which is another useful feature if it worked! Unless I can quickly get this problem resolved, I will be returning the phone.
customer_reviews.author: jjkaye

customer_reviews.title: Inexpensive and reasonably functional
customer_reviews.text: Not bad at all but one item that I find less than optimal. When you use the built-in answering machine, there is no way to silence the outgoing announcement on your end. If you are screening your calls you must listen to yourself and then the received message. That. to me, defeats half the usability of an answering machine. The optimal is when you turn off the ringer (easily done) and only know someone is calling when they leave a message, which you can immediately answer by either using the speaker phone or by picking up the hand set. This one doesn't have the option of silencing the announcement. Other than that it works fine.
customer_reviews.author: Pat-inCO

customer_reviews.title: AT&T CL4940 Corded Standard Phone with Answering System
customer_reviews.text: Answering Machine stopped working after about 9 months, not worth spending the money on shipping to send back for warranty repair. Liked the large display and the sound quality was good. Tried everything suggested by website support (i.e. unplugging power for a few minutes to reset it). Customer support didn't have any suggestions other than unplugging the power. Answering machine portion does not shut off now even when you turn it off. Was hoping to still use the phone portion with a new phone/answering machine purchased, but this phone was messing the new one out, so it goes in the trash.
customer_reviews.author: Bryce N.

customer_reviews.title: Nice while it lasted
customer_reviews.text: Yes some people (old like me) still use desk phones. This one worked as expected for about nine months. Then started saying the line was in use when it wasn't. It does not display caller ID if it thinks the line is in use. Displaying caller ID was the main reason for getting this phone. Then phone suddenly displayed that it was not getting power. I checked the power module with a meter and it is working fine. I will not buy this model to replace it.
customer_reviews.author: diyfool

customer_reviews.title: Nice phone overall.
customer_reviews.text: I didn't give this phone 5 stars because I had the same phone before and it eventually crapped out (didn't give me dial tone when I lifted the receiver). I had the old one 5 or 6 years but was disappointed that it didn't last longer. I like the features and easy to read screen. So far so good on this one. At least not expensive.
customer_reviews.author: Robert D. Beving

customer_reviews.title: I love the big well lit screen.  Easy to see.
customer_reviews.text: Was looking for a phone to replace my cordless one that gave up the ghost. Although not cordless this works great. I particularly love the adjustable well lit screen. The only thing I wish it would do is to let me know when I have a message. I don't use the included answering machine because I have one through my phone provider. My cordless phone used to blink.
customer_reviews.author: R. Wood

customer_reviews.title: Reliability
customer_reviews.text: I have owned this phone for 7 months and recently it has started acting up. Once when trying to call out, the display would show the last number called and not the number that was being dialed which tended to confuse. Today, the message button is blinking but you can't play the message nor turn off the answering machine. These are annoyances to me, along with with Amazon's ridiculous 30 day return policy and only 6 month product support policy for this phone, that was sold by Amazon. Although I have fixed all problems by unplugging the transformer from the phone and the wall outlet. Someday I have to wean myself off Amazon and stop making Bezos wealthier.
customer_reviews.author: Thunderbolt9

customer_reviews.title: Nice phone and answering machine.
customer_reviews.text: Nice phone and answering machine. The display is easy to read but when the phone is wall mounted you have to bend down to read it. The speaker sound and volume are good. The answering machine is fine. The only thing I don't like is that it sometimes loses the clock setting when power is out. That is the reason for 4 stars instead of 5.
customer_reviews.author: Koby

customer_reviews.title: Very average telephone
customer_reviews.text: This phone does the job, although it has some odd characteristics. The speakerphone is pretty terrible, and that seems to be the only way to record and play messages. It's usable, but the clarity is below average. The menu system is a little awkward getting used to, but it's functional as well. The ergonomics of the keys and the message system are good. Bottom line: this is a decent, functional telephone. I rate it as solidly average, but few people probably care about such phones any more.
customer_reviews.author: gwrosenb

customer_reviews.title: Overall A Very Good Phone
customer_reviews.text: This phone has a lot of features and is very easy to setup. The features go deep like being able to select the number of rings before the answering portion picks up the line. The messages can easily be accessed and erased. The keys have a very good tactile touch and labeled very clearly. The LCD screen is very bright and easy to read. For me the only minus is that the Phone tends to display "missed calls" on the top line but they can easily be deleted.
customer_reviews.author: Dean Luedtke

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use
customer_reviews.text: Bought two of these phones for elderly friend, put speed dial instructions and the name of the person and their speed dial # on a piece of paper by each phone. Our friend stays fairly confused and would have trouble dialing regular contacts. This phone is perfect. James Ashley Bossier City, Louisiana
customer_reviews.author: Richard in Louiaiana

customer_reviews.title: There is no mention that the unit has to be ...
customer_reviews.text: There is no mention that the unit has to be plugged into the phone socket and another cord into an electrical outlet for the display, My wall socket in the kitchen for the phone, doesn't have an electrical socket on the same wall.. Would have to run a cord over the table in mid air to connect it.
customer_reviews.author: Rick

customer_reviews.title: Great phone! With most people discontinuing "landline" phones
customer_reviews.text: Great phone! With most people discontinuing "landline" phones, my preference is to have a landline with an answering machine, for those times when I do happen to be out. My only issue with THIS phone is that the black corded answering machine cord is way too short. In order for me to move it from my kitchen counter to my table about 7 feet away, I actually had to purchase an extension cord to enable moving the phone to a different location. The sound is clear; the answering machine works great; it has a caller ID rolodex for callers and their numbers . . . what's not to like??
customer_reviews.author: Lynne F.

customer_reviews.title: good value
customer_reviews.text: I bought the optional 12 foot coiled cord. I like the built-in answering machine, rather than my messages going to my cable / phone company. I also bought the noise reduction adapter. After I saw the first phone, I purchased another to replace a worn out phone. I have the answering machine turned on one of the phones but turned off on the second.
customer_reviews.author: Rick L

customer_reviews.title: While the phone works well at least as far as ...
customer_reviews.text: While the phone works well at least as far as the design goes, the phone looses track of dates etc when power goes out. In our area, that could be every week or two. If there was a battery to keep the date & time syncronized that would be OK, or if the phone would update the date & time from metadata or something but it does none of those things. I end up entering the year every time the power goes out which is often. Anyone know of a battery that I can attach to the phone?
customer_reviews.author: Sailinsteve

customer_reviews.title: GREAT PHONE, but..
customer_reviews.text: This is a really good corded phone with big clear backlit display. Caller ID is perfectly visible in the dark. UNFORTUNATELY the important "HOLD" feature that was on the less expensive model was not included in this "upgraded" model. This is a big disappointment to me as I use it. If it is not useful for you all other functions are good. I did not try the answering machine so do not know how it works.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Buyer Tip:  Download Full Manual here!
customer_reviews.text: Initial experience is all good. Tip: From this website, scroll until you find the orange "Product Information" (left margin) then look for "Technical Specification". Download User Manual .pdf for your future reference. Oddly, the full manual was not in the box, only an abbreviated version.
customer_reviews.author: DIY Guy

customer_reviews.title: Great, except LCD read-out really bothers me
customer_reviews.text: I would have given this phone 5 stars, but the LCD screen makes me feel really awful. I think the electronics are a bit "dirty." I am very sensitive to electromagnetic frequencies of many kinds, so I had hoped this phone would work for me. The sound quality is great, especially the speaker phone. I have found only one other phone with as a good a speaker phone.
customer_reviews.author: lindalou

customer_reviews.title: Great for Seniors!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this phone for my grandmother who has Parkinson's/Dementia. She can no longer dial on a normal phone. Pressing the green "on" and red "off" button is too complicated for her. Needed something simple with bit print that she could just pick up and press the buttons. This phone does just the trick! Would highly recommend for someone in a similar situation.
customer_reviews.author: Deanna D

customer_reviews.title: Not work
customer_reviews.text: Our customer had one of these for 5 years. Then it would say the answering machine is full and would not take messages even though it was completely empty. Bought a new one. Within the month, same problem. Got a third one. Same problem on day 1. Returned and have to keep,shopping. UPDATE: It may work. I found out my customer has voicemail through her phone company and that was full. So it would not ring to the phone.
customer_reviews.author: A C

customer_reviews.title: It's a good wall phone (when it works)
customer_reviews.text: Second phone of same make and model, first one I've had for years, then it just quit sending audio to the handset, this one was purchased in July 2016, it now has the same issue..no audio to the handset, and no, it's not the handset or the cord, there's something internally going bonkers, don't know if I should waste time with another or find a different model? Anyway, when it's 100% it works it's fine.
customer_reviews.author: Martin Vee

customer_reviews.title: Great Land Phone
customer_reviews.text: The AT&T CL4940 phone is the best land phone I have owned. Easy to read screen and very easy to adjust sound level on handset. I highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Larry Latham

product_meta.title: AT&T CL4940 Corded Standard Phone with Answering System and Backlit Display, White
product_meta.description: Cl4940Wht- Corded Answering System.Troubleshooting steps as follows:1. If you are having trouble hearing on the handset, try replacing the handset cord. 2. Please check if you can hear the dial tone. The volume may be turned down too low to hear the other party. Press VOLUME on the base to turn up the volume. 3. Try a handset and/or line cord from a working set. If this corrects the problem, replace the appropriate cord. 4. If you have connected this telephone to a phone jack that has not been used before, or that has not been used in sometime, there may be problems with this jack that you are not aware of. Use a telephone jack that you know is in proper working order. 5. You may have a line problem. To test for a line problem, test your unit at another location. If your unit works at another location, contact your local telephone company.
feature_bullets: Simple, Corded Operation . Line Power Mode . Display Dial . Mute . Last Number Redial . Flash
Receiver Volume Control . Ringer Volume Control . Table and Wall Mountable . Hearing Aid Compatible . English/Spanish/French Setup Menu
Clear speak Dial-in-Base Speakerphone . Speakerphone Volume Control . Caller ID / Call Waiting . 50 Name and Number Caller ID History
Digital Answering System . Call Screen/Intercept . Time and Date Stamp . Message Counter . Big button Display;Message guardR memory for power failure
Backlit Display . Extra-Large Tilt Display . Extra-Large Buttons.Power adapter input:AC120V 60Hz
DSL Subscribers may need to us a DSL Filter

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.3 out of 5 stars4,278 ratings4.3 out of 5 stars
